zone.line: the God himself is he who speaks &
they are merely the mea organs of
his voice. A proof of this may be
foundfound in Tynnichus the Chalchidean, who
never composed no other poem which any
one thinks worth remembering except the
famous pæan which is in every one's
mouth, perhaps without exception the
most beautiful of all lyrical compositions
and which he himself called GREEK
GREEK. I think you will agree with
me, that the gods makes it evident to
show us clearly by such examples
that these beautiful poems are not
human nor from men, but divine
& from the gods; and that poets
are nothing but the inspired inter-
-preters of the gods, each excellent in
proportion to the degree of his inspiration;
and the example of the most beautiful
song having been composed by the
